intro: Eumachia insidens subsp. liberica, commonly known as the Liberian eumachia, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
